instructions: Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 8 1 Open Image titled Android7chrome.png Google Chrome. Tap the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 9 2 Tap . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 10 3 Tap . This option is in the drop-down menu. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 11 4 Tap . You'll find this in the bottom-left corner of the screen. On Android, you'll tap CLEAR BROWSING DATA at the top of the page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 12 5 Make sure "Cookies, Site Data" is checked. If you don't see a checkmark to the right of this option, tap it to select it. On Android, this option is entitled "Cookies and site data". Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 13 6 Select a time range on Android. If you're using Chrome on Android, tap the drop-down menu Image titled Android7dropdown.png in the top-right corner of the screen, then tap All time in the resulting menu. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 14 7 Tap . It's at the bottom of the list of browsing data. On Android, you'll tap CLEAR DATA in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 15 8 Tap when prompted. Doing so will delete your Chrome mobile browser's cookies. On Android, you'll tap CLEAR when prompted. Advertisement

Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 32 1 Open Firefox. Tap the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox wrapped around a blue globe. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 33 2 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 34 3 Tap . This is in the drop-down menu. The settings page will open. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 35 4 Tap . Doing so opens the "Clear private data" menu. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 36 5 Tap . It's at the top of the page. A pop-up window will open. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 37 6 Check the "Cookies & active logins" box. This is near the middle of the pop-up window. If the "Cookies & active logins" box is already checked, skip this step. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 38 7 Tap . It's at the bottom of the pop-up window. Doing so immediately deletes your Android's Firefox browser cookies. Advertisement

Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 58 1 Open your iPhone's Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png Settings. Tap the Settings app icon, which resembles a grey box with gears on it. This process will also work on an iPad or an iPod Touch. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 59 2 Scroll down and tap . It's roughly a third of the way down the Settings page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 60 3 Scroll down and tap . This option is near the bottom of the page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cookies Step 61 4 Tap when prompted. It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will clear your Safari cookies and other web data. This option removes your on-iPhone search history as well. If you just want to delete cookies, instead tap Advanced at the bottom of the page, tap Website Data , tap Remove All Website Data , and tap Remove Now . Advertisement
